subject: RE: [junit] Re: Testing static Properties
msgSnippet: ... Monostate is a variant of a singleton but with the same end result.  Methods belonging to a Monostate class will always return the same result or perform
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On

> Thanks for the reply. I'm not exactly sure what you mean by
> "Monostate,"

Monostate is a variant of a singleton but with the same end result. Methods
belonging to a Monostate class will always return the same result or perform
the same task regarding of the instance:

new Account().getName();
new Account().getName();

will always return the same name.

This is typically implemented by having a public constructor but static
fields.

I've never personally needed a Monostate but it's an intriguing beast.

--
